member.name: IConfigAviMux.GetMasterStream

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMasterStream method queries which stream will be used to synchronize the other streams in the file.

member.param: Receives the index of the master stream, or -1 if no master stream was set.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputCompatibilityIndex method retrieves the setting for the AVI index format.

param.name: pfOldIndex
param.para: Receives one of the following values.

listheader.description: Create an AVI 1.0 index, as well as an AVI 2.0 index.
Create an AVI 2.0 index, but not an AVI 1.0 index.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IConfigAviMux.SetMasterStream

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetMasterStream method specifies a stream that will be used to synchronize the other streams in the file.

member.param: Specifies the index of the stream, or –1 to indicate no master stream. The AVI Mux writes one stream for each connected input pin. Stream numbers are indexed from zero.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IConfigAviMux.SetOutputCompatibilityIndex

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetOutputCompatibilityIndex method sets the AVI index format.

param.name: fOldIndex
param.para: Specifies one of the following values:

listheader.description: Create an AVI 1.0 index, as well as an AVI 2.0 index.
Create an AVI 2.0 index, but not an AVI 1.0 index.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IConfigAviMux interface configures the AVI Mux filter. Applications can use this interface to set the master stream and to create an AVI 1.0 index.
